data.Title: Google Core Update Expected in Coming Weeks
data.Description: Google has announced that the next core update to its search algorithms is expected to roll out in the coming weeks.

data.Title: Google Improves JavaScript Rendering for Search Indexing
data.Description: Google's web crawler now simulates "idle" states to better render JavaScript-heavy websites, leading to improved indexing of deferred content.

data.Title: Google Business Profiles Chat Feature Discontinued
data.Description: Google has removed the chat feature from Google Business Profiles. Users are advised to download their chat history as it will no longer be accessible.

data.Title: Google May Implement Site-Level AI Content Classification
data.Description: There are indications that Google may be developing a site-level score (AGC) to classify websites based on the extent of artificially generated content.

data.Title: Google Discover May Offer Content Exclusion for Publishers
data.Description: Google is exploring the possibility of allowing publishers to exclude specific content from appearing in Google Discover feeds.

data.Title: Google Search Tests "Back to AI Overview" Button
data.Description: Google is A/B testing a new button in search results that allows users to easily return to the AI-powered overview section after scrolling.

data.Title: Google Search Experiments with Highlighted Words and Background Colors
data.Description: Google is experimenting with visual changes to its search results pages, including highlighting keywords in blue and using light background colors.

data.Title: Google Discontinues "Notes on Search" Experiment
data.Description: Google has officially ended its "Notes on Search" experiment, which allowed users to add notes to search results. The feature is no longer available.

data.Title: Taboola Partners with Apple for Native Advertising
data.Description: Taboola has secured a deal with Apple to power native advertising within the Apple News and Apple Stocks applications.

data.Title: AI Training Datasets Raise Copyright Concerns
data.Description: An investigation reveals that AI models from companies like Apple, Nvidia, and Anthropic were trained on datasets containing copyrighted material, including YouTube video transcripts.

data.Title: Google AI Overviews Show Fewer Citations from Reddit and Quora
data.Description: A recent report suggests that Google's AI-powered Overviews feature is displaying fewer citations from sources like Reddit and Quora.

data.Title: Google Tests AI-Organized Local Search Results
data.Description: Following similar tests for shopping results, Google is now experimenting with using artificial intelligence to organize local search results.

data.Title: Google 3D/AR Images May Roll Out to More Websites
data.Description: Google appears to be expanding the availability of its 3D and augmented reality image feature to websites that were not part of the initial pilot program.

data.Title: Google Downplays Importance of Disavow Files
data.Description: Google's John Mueller has stated that website owners should not be overly concerned about having large disavow files or removing them, as they are unlikely to significantly impact rankings.

data.Title: Schema.org Receives Design Update
data.Description: The Schema.org website has undergone a design refresh, which includes an updated validator tool.

data.Title: Google Search to Support AI-Generated Image Labeling
data.Description: Google Search will soon allow users to label images that have been generated or manipulated using artificial intelligence.

data.Title: Google Search Console Adds Shipping and Returns Configuration
data.Description: Website owners can now configure their shipping and returns settings directly within Google Search Console.

data.Title: Google Knowledge Panels Now Display Store Ratings
data.Description: Google has started showing store ratings within knowledge panels, providing users with additional information about businesses.

data.Title: Google Tests Renaming "Short Videos" to "Quick Takes"
data.Description: Google is A/B testing a change in terminology within its search results, potentially renaming "short videos" to "quick takes."

data.Title: Google Ads Renames "Broad Match" to "Intent Match" in Japan
data.Description: Google has renamed its "broad match" keyword targeting option to "intent match" within Google Ads in Japan.

data.Title: Google Tests Query Refinements for Ad Carousels
data.Description: Google is implementing changes to how query refinements function for ad carousels within search results.

data.Title: Chrome Updates Core Web Vitals Measurement
data.Description: The Chrome team has made adjustments to how Interaction to Next Paint (INP) is measured, potentially influencing Core Web Vitals (CWV) data.

data.Title: YouTube Explores Thumbnail Customization for Shorts
data.Description: YouTube is developing a feature that would allow creators to customize the thumbnail frame of their Shorts clips after uploading, including adding text and filters.

data.Title: Google Launches Project Oscar for AI-Powered Bug Monitoring
data.Description: Google has introduced Project Oscar, an open-source platform designed to assist product teams in monitoring and resolving software issues and bugs using AI agents.
